humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, a single (of 3) left axillary sentinel lymph node (SLN No. 1) is positive for an isolated tumor cell cluster (AJCC pNO.(i+)(sn)). However, based on the new rule 10 and new rule 11, N0 can indicate no metastatic carcinoma in sentinel lymph nodes and regional lymph nodes or that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma. In this case, the nonsentinel lymph node is negative for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has isolated tumor cell clusters (less than 0.2 mm) in a sentinel lymph node, which is consistent with a pathologic N1 (pN1mi) stage according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system. This is based on the report's mention of a 'single (of 3) left axillary sentinel lymph node (SLN No. 1) is positive for isolated tumor cell cluster [AJCC pNO. (i+) (sn)]'.
